content.question: As shown in the top view diagram, a person exerts a perpendicular force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> on a door at a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from the hinge. The length of the door is <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, and the door has rotational inertia <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> about the hinge. The door rotates about the hinge with negligible friction. Which of the following expressions is equal to the tangential acceleration of the right end of the door?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction d F over l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction d squared F over l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>F</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction L F d over l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction L squared F over l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>F</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction L F d over l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Newton's Second Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
